metadata.title: CVE-2020-27784 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A vulnerability was found in the Linux kernel, where accessing adeallocated instance in printer_ioctl() printer_ioctl() tries to access ofa printer_dev instance. However, use-after-free arises because it had beenfreed by gprinter_free().

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-27784` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-129-generic - 4.15.0-129.132
linux-image-4.15.0-129-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-129.132
linux-image-4.15.0-129-lowlatency - 4.15.0-129.132
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-129-generic - 4.15.0-129.132
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-129-lowlatency - 4.15.0-129.132
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-56-generic - 5.4.0-56.62~18.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-129.132').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-56.62~18.04.1').

linux-aws package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1091.96').
